Issues.Title: Give TreeView control test more nodes
Issues.Body:
All changes are in the resx file. Code-behind is serialized using the new designer, thus color depth field was  added. Also this was serialized on a 100% monitor, thus sizes had changed.
The purpose of this change was to see if https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7056 still repros :(

Issues.Title: Reverse resetting the Anchorinfo when size chnages.
Issues.Body:
This is a regression caused by #6778 that was helping optimize anchor info calculation.
However, in certain scenarios, we access `AnchorInfo` by assuming it was initialized at the time of handle creation and resetting it to null with `size change` is causing null reference exception in those scenarios.  Given regression was introduced in the current preview, taking this revert while we are investigating on how to get anchor layout working for higher DPI machines.

Fixes #7159 and #7090

Issues.Title: [dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3] WinForm Apps thrown Object reference not set to an instance of an object when setting values to Label.Text
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

**Verify Scenarios:**
1). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3: Fail
2). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22258.1: Fail
3). Windows10 RS5 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.4.22252.9: Pass

### Issue description

**Application Name**:  pomodoroflavors, HeroesPowerPlant, GameofLife
**OS:** Windows 10 RS5
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Number**: dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3

When testing the above 3rd party apps against dotnet-sdk-7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3, it fails with "Object reference not set to an instance of an object" when setting values to Label.Text.

**Findings:**

1. If we set Text from Properties window, then change the Text value from button click event, it works fine.
2. If original text string is number and changed string is characters, or original text string is characters and changed string is number,  and the length should be same before and after change, the issue will appear.

**StackTrace from Application:**
See the end of this message for details on invoking
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
```
************** Exception Text **************
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.GetAnchorDestination(IArrangedElement element, Rectangle displayRect, Boolean measureOnly)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.LayoutAnchoredControls(IArrangedElement container)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.TryCalculatePreferredSize(IArrangedElement container, Boolean measureOnly, Size& preferredSize)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.LayoutCore(IArrangedElement container, LayoutEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs levent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Form.OnLayout(LayoutEventArgs levent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout(LayoutEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.PerformLayout()
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ResumeLayout(Boolean performLayout)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Label.OnTextChanged(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.set_Text(String value)
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.UpdateCountdownOnScreen() in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 66
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.StartCountdownTimer(Int32 minutesToCountdown) in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 42
   at PomodoroDesktop.Pomodoro.btnPomodoro_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in F:\Onboardapps\pomodoroflavors-main\pomodoroflavors-main\PomodoroDesktop\ResultProject\PomodoroDesktop\Pomodoro.cs:line 25
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mevent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)

```

### Steps to reproduce

**Minimal Repro steps:**
**The machine only has 7.0.100-preview.5.22257.3 installed. The Demo project is attached.
[WinFormsDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8660697/WinFormsDemo.zip)
 **

1. Create a default WinForm App with Visual Studio and target the app to .NET 7.0
2. Drag a Label and a Button control to the form.
3. Double click the button and add below code in Form1.cs file: 
```
        public Form1()
        {
            InitializeComponent();
            label1.Text = "aaa";
        }

        private void button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {
            label1.Text = "123";
        }
```

4. Press F5 to launch the app.
5. Click button.

**Expected Result:** 
The Label's Text content will become "123".

**Actual Result:**
It will throw Object reference not set to an instance exception. The stack trace shows:
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.Layout.DefaultLayout.GetAnchorDestination(IArrangedElement element, Rectangle displayRect, Boolean measureOnly)
```

@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat

Issues.Title: Optimizing virtual mode checking when user uses keyboard to change checkbox state
Issues.Body:
Fixes #6096

## Proposed changes

Optimizing virtual mode checking when user uses keyboard to change checkbox state.
Changed ListView.cs at line 6702:
if (CheckBoxes) 
to 
if (CheckBoxes && !VirtualMode)
Existing unit test:
ListView_WmReflectNotify_LVN_KEYDOWN_SpaceKey_HasCheckBoxes_WithoutGroups_CheckedExpected

## Customer Impact
Optimized algorithm enhances performance and is easy to support. 

## Regression? 
No

## Risk
Minimal

## Test methodology
Unit tests

## Test environment(s)
Microsoft Windows [Version 120.2212.4170.0]
.NET Core SDK: 7.0.100-preview.3.22179.4

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Change DataGridView's Row/Column counting with starting at 1, not 0
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

**.Net 7.0 SDK build:** 7.0.100-preview.5.22256.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this is not a regression issue. And @merriemcgaw wants a runtime issue to ask to change the counting with starting at 1.

### Issue description

We need to change DataGridView's Row/Column counting with starting at 1, not 0

**Accessibility Insight:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/167351421-e205255b-db5e-49d2-a7d2-101f12f660b8.png)

**Inspect:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/167351625-a95d5566-bbb8-4df6-ba55-d3656b740de2.png)

**Narrator:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/167351903-ad50b27f-670f-4160-bd85-89ac78ee40f9.png)


### Steps to reproduce

**Repro steps:**
1. Open attached application
[DataGridView_Sample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8649203/DataGridView_Sample.zip)
2. Build and run
3. Use Accessibility tools: AccessiblityInsight, Narrator, Inspect focus on the first DataGridView cell, to observe the rows/columns starting count
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Change DataGridView's Row/Column counting with starting at 1, not 0" (#7154)

It's working in old .net framework designer.

### Issue description

Can't edit struct properties  (Size, Padding etc.) directly due to wrong values separator. See video from _steps to reproduce_.
This error will appear:

> 486, 421 is not a valid value for Int32. (Parameter 'value')

New designer value separator is **comma**:
![net](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17767561/167296948-36e50b81-e8aa-44e8-8a3a-11f8a694e49b.png)

Old designer value separator is **semicolon**:
![netfw](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17767561/167296950-728675e0-6e78-48a7-b245-393755438ccd.png)



### Steps to reproduce

V.S. language is English. Windows language is English. Region and regional format in windows settings - Ru.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17767561/167297112-b7228dc7-6f15-4ff2-b487-e3a995e4561e.mp4


Issues.Title: Feasabilty of enabling Trim on WinForms by manually providing the roots file?
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET Runtime 6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

N/A

### Issue description

Discussion tag please

This documentation describes how to provide a list of assemblies to preserve: https://github.com/dotnet/linker/blob/main/docs/data-formats.md

We have a large .NET Runtime application that is mostly ASP.NET Core, but also some Console, and a single small WinForms application whose sole purpose is to edit the configuration files. The team is really excited about trimmed single files and wants to publish the whole application to single file depolyment if possible. I've already solved the problem of how to amalgamate a bunch of applications to a single build for single file deployment.

What's the feasibility of manually providing the roots for COM interop endpoints so that ILLink sees them as rooted and doesn't remove them? The winforms application is so small we can walk all events on all controls in less than an hour and know full well whether it works or not.

All controls used in no particular order:
* Button
* ListView
* TextBox
* Label
* Panel
* TabControl
* DataGridView (It's given a list of objects with string properties, no DataSet used anywhere)
* ComboBox
* TextBox
* CheckBox
* RichTextBox (mistake: a TextBox should have been used and I'll gladly switch it if it saves trouble)

Originally we shipped the Winforms binary as a .NET Framework binary; however we can no longer do so as this caused two issues:
* It is not possibly to load .NET Runtime assemblies from .NET Framework anymore, even to reflect on them rather than run code in them.
* The application did not work on Windows Server Core. We have since gone out of our way to make the config tool run on Server Core with the .NET Core/Runtime version of WinForms.

### Steps to reproduce

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feasabilty of enabling Trim on WinForms by manually providing the roots file?" (#7149)
